dc_title_s: LiDAR-Derived Countywide 60-cm Hillshade Image for Richland County, WI 2021
dc_description_s: This data represents a LiDAR-derived 60-cm Bare Earth DEM Hillshade Image for Richland County, Wisconsin in 2021. This dataset is in the WTM coordinate system: EPSG 3071. Hillshading is a technique used to visualize terrain as shaded relief, illuminating it with a hypothetical light source. The illumination value for each raster cell is determined by its orientation to the light source, which is based on slope and aspect.
dc_creator_sm: Wisconsin Department of Administration - Geographic Information Office
uw_supplemental_s: This lidar data dataset was created by the WisconsinView Partners (WVP) – the WI Department of Administration’s Geographic Information Office in collaboration with the UW-Madison Space Science and Engineering Center’s (SSEC) WisconsinView repository. Original lidar data in tiled format from federal or local county/city lidar projects were used to create countywide mosaics of datasets such as DEMS, Intensity images, and DSMs in various projections and coordinate systems. For detailed metadata please visit: https://web.s3.wisc.edu/wsco-wisconsinview/lidar/Richland/Richland_2021_3DEP_Delivery/Metadata/Metadata.zip
